page.title: 06HOW A VILLAGE HAS CHANGED
page.content: Mrs. Green has lived in Webheath since 1950 when the village was smaller. When she was younger there were flower shows, youth clubs, a bowling green behind the Village Hall and more shops, including a drapers. Men were farm labourers or worked in the needle industries in Redditch. The school was housed in the Village Hall and was very small only having 15 children. The children started at 5. When they got to 7 they went to St.Lukes. All the children went home for lunch. They had 1 big classroom split into 2. Webheath Primary school was built in 1959 on fields belonging to the council.It was for children of 5-11 years. It'S called a First school now with children from 5-9 years. The children played with bean bags,quoits ropes or made up their own games from the things they found around them.
